alert.note: Alert for Alpine; Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 6:20AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: .Localized heavy rain showers early this morning over the Tamarack burn area may produce areas of flooding near Markleeville. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central California, including the following counties, Alpine and Mono. Portions of western Nevada, including the following county, Douglas. * WHEN...Until 915 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past hour, including saturated soils from the past week of wetting rains. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grover Hot Springs, Alpine County Airport, Turtle Rock Campground, Markleeville and Holbrook Junction. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
